main event: A white-colored light was observed falling near Red Springs, North Carolina on June 23, 1958.
interesting points: The light was observed by the co-pilot during a refueling mission involving a B-52 and KB-50,Multiple VOR stations in the region reported seeing the same light as the co-pilot,There were thunderstorms present in the area at the time of the sighting,Static electricity phenomena were reported just prior to the refueling,The aurora borealis was highly visible shortly after the event.
witness description: co-pilot and lieutenant who communicated with VOR stations
